metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4382 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw caused by a race among the superblock operations in the gadgetfs Linux driver was found. It could be triggered by yanking out a device that is running the gadgetfs side. Gerald Lee discovered that the USB Gadget file system implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-146-lowlatency - 5.4.0-146.163
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1099-aws - 5.4.0-1099.107
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-aws - 5.15.0-1033.37~20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> Because the USB gadget interface is for when the system is acting as a USB device rather than a host, the USB Gadget FS is not mounted by default in Ubuntu.
